Pyspatialml¶

Pyspatialml is a Python package for applying scikit-learn machine learning models to raster-based datasets. It is inspired by the famous raster package in the R statistical programming language which has been extensively used for applying statistical and machine learning models to geospatial raster datasets.

Pyspatialml includes functions and classes for working with multiple raster datasets and applying a typical machine learning workflow including raster data manipulation, feature engineering, extraction of training data, and application of the predict or predict_proba methods of scikit-learn estimator objects to a stack of raster datasets.

Pyspatialml is built upon the rasterio Python package which performs all of the heavy lifting, and is designed towork with the geopandas package for related raster-vector data geoprocessing operations.
